theory: Nami will wield the ancient weapon Uranus, based on her prodigal navigation skills that others describe as 'sorcery', 'supernatural', or 'god-given'. Supporting evidence includes her ability to ride a sky waver that took native Skypieans 10 years to learn, suggesting a special connection to weather and climate.
author: Various One Piece fans

theory: Nami has a connection to Imu and House Nerona. The theory notes that reversing Imu's name gives 'Umi' (Japanese for 'sea'), while Nami's name means 'wave'. Additionally, the last two letters of 'Nerona' and first two of 'Imu' spell 'Nami', suggesting a potential familial or historical connection.
author: Various One Piece theorists

source.title: This 'One Piece' Theory Proves Nami and Imu May Secretly Be Connected

theory: Episode 34 marks a turning point in understanding Nami's character. Some fans theorize that Nami's self-sacrifice (stabbing her own hand to save Usopp) foreshadows her continued pattern of protecting others at great personal cost, which becomes a recurring theme throughout the series.
author: One Piece community discussions
